reviews.review_msg: I found Dr. Elle to be very "inside the box". She does not reward critical thinking, and has very specific ideas on what is correct. She has a nasty temper, was often condescending, and got mad at people when they had difficulty understanding something. As an A student, I still found her to be incredibly rude and was afraid to approach her.

Initially intimidating, Dr. Elle was actually very approachable. Although she marks fairly hard, the assignments and exams aren't terribly difficult and she gives out many extra credit assignments to make up for it. Book isn't necessary providing you attend all lectures, which I'd recommend. Overall a very enjoyable class/professor.

Probably the best course i've ever taken at sfu  - great opportunity to practice critical thinking and improve my writing! Lectures were clear and interesting. 
 With that being said, Dr. Elle can be pretty intimidating and has been known lose it on students. I had no problems, but tread carefully..
I posted the previous rating and messed up the numbers! The comments of her being awesome and helpful still stand!

She's an excellent teacher and very funny. Her lectures are interesting and I'm never bored because she has such a great way of putting the concepts of this course. She wants her students to do well but it is still challenging. She is always willing to help students do their best. Even if plants aren't your thing, she makes this course worthwhile.

She expects students to work hard, think deeply and contribute. She does end to have a sort temper, but if you work hard (this is a 400 level course) she's great. Definitely work through the problems she suggests and actively participate in class.
As long as you show initiative she is very helpful, don't expect a free ride. Open to new ideas, just make sure you've thought them through.
Best prof I've ever had - and most people in the class said the same thing.  Definitely inspiring...

Can respond in a vicious & disrespectful manner if she doesn't like what you're saying.  Dismissive of thoughts that might not agree completely with her narrow, "inside-the-box" perspectives.  If you're submissive she'll answer your questions, but don't have any ideas of your own!  Be the blank slate!

Dr. Elle is one of the best profs I've had.  She's certainly not easy, but her expectations are fair - she expects us to be able to think (shocker!).  If you want to regurgitate the course material you're not going to like her, but if you actually want to LEARN she's the best prof to have.

BEWARE of this teacher.  Her lectures are interesting and straight forward but her tests are marked really hard.  She also has some sort self-esteem/anger management problem and will attack you if you do something to irritate her.

Interesting lectures and clear notes.  However, her marking is unnecessarily tough. If you are worried about the grade you are going to receive in this course, take the course at another time with a different prof.
